snippet: Though his country is in shambles, President Bashar al-Assad now seems better positioned to hang on to power than he has been for most of Syria’s two-year civil war.
abstract: Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad seems better positioned to hang on to power than he has been for most of country's two-year civil war; though Syria is largely in shambles, Assad's hold on big cities is being sustained by superior weapons and rebel infighting; Assad continues to be firmly backed by Russia, Iran and Hezbollah.
lead_paragraph: Though his country is in shambles, President Bashar al-Assad now seems better positioned to hang on to power than he has been for most of Syria’s two-year civil war.

headline.main: Momentum Shifts in Syria, Bolstering Assad’s Position
headline.print_headline: Momentum Shifts in Syria, Bolstering Assad’s Position

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
